name: RetrievePayrollInputs
description:
Retrieve all payroll inputs with required query parameters.

This tool retrieves all payroll inputs using the Workday API. At least one query parameter is required. The tool provides details on payroll inputs and their editability status, allowing users to view their payroll data. Useful for accessing and managing payroll information.

parameters.name: end_date_filter
parameters.description: The end date for filtering payroll inputs, active on or before this date, in yyyy-mm-dd format.

value_schema.description: The end date filter which returns payroll inputs that are active on or before the end date, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: max_objects_per_response
parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of payroll inputs to return in a single response. Defaults to 20, maximum is 100.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: response_offset_index
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in the response. Default is 0. Use with 'limit' for paging, e.g., limit=5 and offset=9 returns 5 objects starting at the 10th object.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: pay_component_ids
parameters.description: An array of Workday IDs for pay components, used to filter payroll inputs. Retrieve IDs from GET /values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the pay component for the payroll input. You can use a returned id from GET /values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents.

parameters.name: start_date_filter
parameters.description: A date in yyyy-mm-dd format to filter payroll inputs active on or after this date.

value_schema.description: The start date filter which returns payroll inputs that are active on or after the start date, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: worker_ids
parameters.description: List of Workday IDs for workers to filter payroll inputs. Use IDs from GET /workers in the Staffing service.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of worker for the payroll input. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Workday API

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date filter which returns payroll inputs that are active on or before the end date, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

value_schema.description: The end date filter which returns payroll inputs that are active on or before the end date, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: payComponent
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the pay component for the payroll input. You can use a returned id from GET /values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the pay component for the payroll input. You can use a returned id from GET /values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date filter which returns payroll inputs that are active on or after the start date, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

value_schema.description: The start date filter which returns payroll inputs that are active on or after the start date, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: The Workday ID of worker for the payroll input. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of worker for the payroll input. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
